text: an estimated 3.3 million people have
been killed throughout the Democratic
Republic of Congo since 1998 making it
the deadliest conflict for civilians
since the Second World War
Bosco Ntaganda founded the m23 rebel
group that was defeated by the Congolese
government in late 2013 after an
18-month insurgency according to a UN
investigation
he built a lucrative business empire
collecting taxes from mines and other
interests one Human Rights Watch
researcher whose met mr. Tintin ganda
describes him as someone who has a
certain presence and charisma he's
nicknamed The Terminator in March 2013
he surprised everyone by walking into
the US Embassy in Rwanda and asking to
be transferred to the Hague his
unexpected surrender has been described
as an act of self-preservation after
losing a power struggle within his own
rebel army the ICC prosecutor fatou
Bensouda says he has a notorious
reputation and is just as dangerous as
the Ugandan rebel leader Joseph Chloe
Bosco Ntaganda denies all 18 charges
against him the trial is expected to
last four years
